transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi, is this Zhi? Hey, it’s Arjun from MongoDB. Do you have a minute to chat?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Uh, yeah, hi Arjun. Sure, I have a couple minutes. How can I help?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Awesome, thanks Zhi. I’m reaching out because I noticed Acme Corp’s been modernizing its microservices and saw you’re currently using Firebase for your data stack—is that right?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, that's correct. We’ve been on Firebase for a while, but we’re looking at options as we scale out—why do you ask?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Well, we’ve been working with a lot of fintech companies on exactly this—helping them move away from monolithic or single-cloud systems to something a bit more flexible. Have you run into any limitations with Firebase so far?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Honestly, yeah. The scaling and data model work great for mobile, but with microservices… things are getting messy. Also, failover’s a concern.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally hear you. Atlas might help here—it’s a multi-cloud developer data platform, so your data can span AWS, GCP, Azure. We’ve got built-in multi-region failover.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: But is that, uh, does it mean we get locked into MongoDB? Vendor lock-in is a pretty big topic for us, especially with compliance and all.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Great question. Actually, one of the reasons fintechs choose Atlas is flexibility—we support hybrid cloud, and you can self-host MongoDB if needed. Data’s always yours.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: If regulations change, you could move workloads on-prem or to another provider—migrations in and out are supported.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Okay, that’s interesting. How about, you know, latency and performance? Our users are global so…

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah—latency’s a big one. Atlas lets you deploy clusters near your users, with automatic failover if a region has issues. We see sub-50ms reads in most regions.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: And, um, security certifications? We’re under SOC 2, PCI, and GDPR requirements.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely, Atlas is certified for SOC 2, PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, GDPR, the works. Most fintech compliance boxes are checked.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Okay, that’s ticking a lot of boxes. But, uh, migration always scares me, especially with the volume of data we have. How risky is it really?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Honestly, it’s a concern we get all the time. We have tools and a dedicated migration team—happy to walk you through a low-risk, staged migration with zero downtime.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Hmm, okay. Do you have any fintech customers using Atlas at really high scale?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Yes—folks like Stripe and Robinhood use Atlas at massive scale. Can share case studies, if that’s helpful.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, I’d like to see those. Maybe a deeper dive with my team?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely. How about we schedule a call next week, dig into your current architecture and potential migration path?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Sounds good. Can you send me some times and those case studies?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Will do! Thanks for the time, Zhi—looking forward to the follow up.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Thank you, Arjun. Talk soon.
